subject: Re: [junit] BeforeClass Listener
msgSnippet: Hi David, How can I know if there is a feature request for it ? When the next release with feature will be release ? Can you send patch for current version ?
messageBody:
Hi David,

How can I know if there is a feature request for it ?
When the next release with feature will be release ?
Can you send patch for current version ? (We are working with 4.4)

Thanks


David Saff wrote:
>
> idan72,
>
> There is no easy way with JUnit 4.5, but it's functionality we're
> going to need in .6 or .7. Can you make sure there's a feature
> request for it?
>
> If you need to brainstorm about hard ways to do it, let me know.
>
> David Saff
>
> On Sun, Oct 5, 2008 at 4:33 PM, idan72 <ishai@...> wrote:
>>
>> Hi,
>>
>> How can I know when a beforeclass is starting?
>>
>> Today with the listener I can know when test start but I need to also
>> know
>> when @BeforeClass method and @AfterClass method starts.
>>
>> It is very important to our project.
>>
>> Thanks
>>
>> --
>> View this message in context:
>> http://www.nabble.com/BeforeClass-Listener-tp19828897p19828897.html
>> Sent from the JUnit - User mailing list archive at Nabble.com.
>>
>>
>
>

--
